column4: How to load alsa? I've unloaded alsa modules via (sudo /sbin/alsa force-unload) and now want sound back without restarting whole the system
modprobe what you unloaded?
I've just executed that script. I don't know what modules it unloaded. Is there a way to... just start alsa?
or how to make system to reindentify needed modules?
and load them too
no idea, sorry
no it's nice
you just shouldn't force unload modules, really
yes, looks like
i never have to restart alsa (besides it's not a service one can restart) it's kernel modules
but alsa force-reload didn't help this time
and it just works for me
what computer/soundcard do you have? which applications do you use?
if you use gnome/kde the artsdaemon and the other softwaremixer, that's crap

but not for me. Without 'force-reload' "cheat" I can't get sound more then 2-4 hours. Apps like MOCP can't start, claiming it can't access something. So I have to force-reload alsa, and then MOCP works
you run karmic?
try to use OSS instead of ALSA, if that works better, i don't know
did you check the mocp bugs/development page, maybe it's known?
MOCP application, 9.04, latest (I think) alsa (built using that fancy script found on Ubuntu forums)
or try to figure out what software is causing the problems
i'm pretty sure it's not alsa
yeah, default 9.04's alsa cound't even work on my laptop - Acer 5930G :( So I had to built latest
